caption: Great drinks. Great food. Great place.
Had a very good experience in this spot with my kids. The food comes quick and the service is just excellent. Prices are fair.

DELICIOUS! All plant based menu! And it was amazing. The plates are shareable and so flavorful! We had the Cauliflower tacos, brussel sprouts, Peruvian potatoes, pretzel fondue, and apple cinnamon tart- ZERO COMPLAINTS. would order it all again. Additionally, the drinks were SO GOOD. one of the best drinks of my life - had the “smoke one” can’t remember it’s name lol except it has smoke in the title.
All of the dishes that we ordered were delicious. We had the Fondue, the Peruvian Potatoes, and the Dan Dan Noodles. Service was perfectly attentive. We can't wait to go back.
Amazing delivery in The time of covid! Accommodating to glutenfree diets. We loved this place when we could dine inside and wish them all the best and to please stay!
Good food and drinks. A must visit!!
Incredible food and exceptional service, we cant wait to go back
Ugh nothing better than that fondue.

The Fancy Radish is evidence that magic is possible, and that the people who design this menu and work in the kitchen are some type of food wizards.  The house cocktails are amazing blends of flavor and smell, without detracting from the meal in any way.  When you visit, don't limit yourself, try a cocktail or three, order an item from each section of the menu, and don't forget to save room for dessert!  Be amazed as the magicians behind the scenes prepare for you what might be one of the best meals you've had, let alone the best vegetarian meal you've ever had.  The seating can be isolated, or you can be in close proximity to your fellow diners, but it is not a bad thing to have strangers to share the wonder of the menu with.  Even when I've come to the restaurant alone, people can't help but be curious what those around them decided to try that they are missing out on, and conversation comes easy over the absolutely delicious meals that can be had here.
One of the most delicious foods I have ever had in my life!

Top-notch 100% vegan fine dining! This place is a little pricey, but you definitely get what you pay for. The ambiance is cool, and the food is creative and flavorful. We ordered the entire farmer's table section of the menu, and also the maitake mushrooms, and dan dan noodles (very spicy, and tasty). Adam provided great service and accommodated slight modifications to the menu. Would definitely recommend for a nice evening out. And we had chocolate beignets with rosemary caramel sauce, and a blackberry pb cup... 5 stars!

This is just one example of the many tasty dishes that we had tonight at Fancy Radish! I'm usually a vegetarian so this wasn't a hard sell for me but I was with meat eaters and they were equally pleased with the delicious food. Service was super friendly - I recommend to order one of everything! The small plates will please all!

Incredible! You definitely don't need to be vegan to love this amazing culinary adventure. My family loves meat but this is one of our favorite places in DC. Order 1 of every dish to share - each one is absolutely delish!
Great service. Fantastic food

Wow - everything on the menu was delicious. One of the best  vegan restaurants around. The beet toast was one of my favorites dishes and the cocktails were great too! I dont get to DC much, but will definitely be visiting again soon.
So, so good! Peruvian potatoes, beet toast, rutabaga fondue, spicy dan dan noodles: everything was a hit. Can't wait to go back!
Unbelievably delicious, creative vegan menu  We ordered 3 plates for 2 people plus dessert and were satisfied!
Amazing creative, varied, and wonderful vegan food. Highly recommend.
Truly one of the finest restaurants in the district.  Whether you're veggie or not.

This place blow my mind 🤯 very delicious food I can highly recommend the broccolini, Peruvian potatoes, the noodles, the radish was espectacular and the desserts I loved the ice cream (forgot the name) everything taste really good, good price totally worth it, great environment is better if you make a reservation with days prior, people is friendly and good service

Fancy Radish is the best restaurant in DC, vegan or not. The dishes are inspired, complex, exciting and consistent! The cocktails are perfection and the service is divine. Fancy Radish is my favorite place to dine, and 100% deserving of the Washington City Paper's "Best Vegan Restaurant" title. The "competition" down the block offers flavorless food with terrible service. I'm shocked they're still in business. I tell ALL my friends from out of town to eat at Fancy Radish, because I know it will impress. 10 Stars!  Bravo!

Went to this place for the first time in 2019.  Had an amazing experience and would say it's the best restaurant find of the year for me personally.  Been back several times and will continue to come.  And I'm a meat eater!  Dan Dan noodles hands down my favorite dish.
Great place for amazing food. Staff is knowledgeable and friendly. Definitely a must-go date night or celebration spot.
So delicious order everything

My son turned 14 yeasterday.  I planed a quiet dinner for 4 that some how turned in to 8. Fancy Radish accommodated us. This is a small  intimate restaurant. I was so pleased  because being vegan for the  last 3 years has been a little difficult for a teenager. I wanted him to enjoy the experience of vegan  sheared dining. The host was pleasant and helpful. The service was on point they worked together and knew exactly whom ordered what. The food does come out staggered. I liked that because the flavors are  so different that you just want to taste everything! My son absolutely Love Love Loved the food! As I  have dined at this location and V Street in Philadelphia I will continue to come back again  and again. Thank you Fancy Radish and staff for helping to make my son's 14th Birthday a special one!
Food was great

Holy wow!!! Went here for my wife’s birthday at her request. Had always heard good things but always was hard to get a last second reservation. Now I know why - this place is legit amazing. I’m not on meatless diet but you don’t even notice here. All of the food and flavors are spectacular. Nothing was a letdown. We absolutely loved the rutabaga fondue! It tasted a lot like my moms Czech “svitčkova”. The fancy radish, the Brussels, the mushrooms and the Dan dan noodles were all really good, I recommend them all.  This place is a DC gem! If you haven’t been, go!
Love it here. As meat eaters, we are constantly amazed by the creativity and artistry that goes into the food here.
Ethical, moral, and environmentally friendly culinary delights served by a friendly and funny staff.

Amazing ALL VEGAN food and very attentive service! Best item on the menu was the Peruvian Potatoes!! The spicy sauce on the potatoes is so good. The fondue was also really good.  My only feedback was to mix the menu up some. Many of the items seem to be deep fried. Maybe less fried foods? The dessert, Blackberry PB Cup was so delightful.

We had an exceptional experience! The menu isn't overly extensive, which is not a bad thing. There's plenty to choose from without being overwhelmed. After talking for a bit, we decided to get one of everything, since the plates are small and made to share. Nothing disappointed! We loved each of the plates, so much so, there were no leftovers. Service was very attentive and pleasant. Highly recommended!

Some of my favorite food in the world. The fancy radish dish is absolutely amazing but you honestly can’t go wrong. The drinks were perfect and the atmosphere and the service were amazing. Love this place!
This place rocked!
Not a vegan at all but had a great meal with good service and ambience.

The service was friendly, prompt, & very informative. Food was absolutely delicious and creative! Beautiful presentation of food on each plate we received. I will definitely come back here when I visit DC and celebrating ! The only downside to the restaurant is the prices are very high for very small plates. I just wanted bigger plates because the food was so delicious!
Yum!

Disappointing experience at the bar. The $14 cocktails were pre-mixed - unlike other bars in town that actually go to the trouble of crafting cocktails for their patrons. The staff was not very friendly and we definitely did not feel welcome. The food, however, was beautifully presented and truly outstanding.

Amazing!  Both the service and the food were impeccable. My party ordered a host of plates and we were blown away by almost all of them. The beet toasts were my favorite, but the Maitake was also a highlight. The Fondue wasn’t particularly special, though the bread was quite tasty. The food was so good that I didn’t even remember to take a picture!  That said, service was super helpful and fast - even on a packed Saturday! We didn’t have reservations, so we sat at the chefs counter. Since they couldn’t seat us by the end of our dinner, our server came out with complimentary dessert for our party, really thoughtful and wasn’t expecting it. I will definitely go back!
Excellent customer service! Gr8 eat and best expo
Great service!

As a meat eater who has been to a lot of mediocre at best vegan places I was VERY skeptical when my friends suggested this. But o oh my god this place is SO GOOD. The fondue is amazing, the spicy Dan Dan noodles were delicious and the smoked tofu dish I had was incredible. I had no idea vegan food could be this good! I'm definitely going back to try more dishes, it seems like everything tastes amazing. Also a great drinks program!
Get the fondue. That's it, that's the review.
Best vegan restaurant in town

The food is very good and the ambiance is nice. The vegan fondue and bread was delicious. The spicy noodles were mouth-watering. Lots and lots and lots of spice though - not for the faint of heart. It is definitely over-priced, but overall a pretty good experience.

"Guys, this is THE best meal of my life." Those words have NEVER slipped out of my mouth before and it's really hard for me to say something I don't mean. I barely even write reviews!  Had no idea what to expect from Fancy Radish but we started with 3 dishes, then ordered 3 more and could have kept going if it wasn't for wanting dessert.  Every. single. dish was perfection. Unique, deliciously surprising, balanced, and beautifully presented.  Service was excellent as well. Eva gave us the best recommendations - dishes we never would have ordered ourselves yet ended up loving the most! She even surprised us with a cranberry sorbet to accompany our two desserts and we really appreciated that, especially since it was also something we normally wouldn't have gotten but ended up drooling over. Very thoughtful. You could see she really believed in the mission of the restaurant and was happy to share her passion for it!  We learned that the restaurant takes being plant based extremely seriously. Not only is the food entirely vegan, but even their food delivery services and food sources must have zero animal/dairy products associated with them. Impressive!!  I really hope they expand westward to where I live in Southern California and (in the future,) Oregon, as there's a huge market out there for food like this!  Dishes we ordered: Smoked Chioggia Beet Toast, Pastrami Spiced Carrots, Rutabaga Fondue, Peruvian Potatoes, Grilled Delicata Squash, Spicy Dan Dan Noodles, then Sticky Toffee Pudding and the Pear Tart for dessert.

Very, very good, and unique in DC for its entirely plant-based, upscale menu. Subtracted one star because I feel the dishes didn’t push the creativity quite far enough. Most things tasted as I expected, with the exception of the smoked carrots and sauerkraut, which was amazing. Definitely worth a stop.
Amazing Vegetarian Food
Yes.
Absolutly wonderful.  This is a must even if not a vegi guru.   .
Service was seamless and the plant-based food was spicy and satisfying. I wish they offered the strawberry shortcake, but November is not the season for this dessert.🍓

The food is certainly delicious no doubt about it. Occasionally I sit at the bar to eat if there's no tables available, and the male bartender there is usually rude and catty but I don't let that stop me from enjoying the Spicy Dan Dan Noodles and Peruvian Potatoes. I absolutely love coming here just for those 2 plates.. It is expensive for the portion size but the quality is well worth it.
Delicious, flavorful vegan food. Beautiful plates, excellent service.
Absolutely perfect in every way! Delicious appetizers, perfectly portioned main meals, and I could not ask for more! An absolute must if you’re in DC.

Extremely impressive! Really changes one's perception of vegetarian food! Every dish was delicious. We had one of everything and nothing ever disappointed. I'd definitely recommend the spicy Dan Dan noodles and you can never run out of their bread and fondue. If I had one quibble, it would be the lack of consistency. Each dish ordered was repeated multiple times by us and there was a definite deteoration in the flavour and quality. But, nevertheless a rare five star rating from me. I loved the food and the attention by the staff. Also, do try their unfiltered wines. They are beautiful.
Had one of the most beautiful meals ever here. The restaurant itself has a very intimate feel and the service was excellent.  If I'm ever back in DC I'll be sure to return.
Delicious.
Absolutely amazing plantbased cuisine.  Thoughtful on every detail.

My coworkers and I went to Fancy Radish and ordered everything on the menu. As always, the food was incredible. They were also really helpful and knowledgeable about allergies, which I appreciated. My only complaints: it was really cold inside, and I wish the space was a bit fancier to reflect the pricing and name.
Amazing!
Very attentive to food allergies. Knew more than I did about my family members restrictions. Great service. Heavenly food options. Ordered the whole menu. Loud inside though.
Very nice and yummy selection of small plates.
Lovely meal tonight!

Amazing food. You'd be hard pressed to tell it was all vegan (especially the desserts). We enjoyed every dish. Plates are great for sharing. The cocktails and wine were good too. I recommend sitting at the bar for happy hour and then sticking around for dinner.  Went back a second time, and it was just as good as the first time! Amazing service, fun/inventive cocktails, solid wine list, and of course the food is amazing! We went with another couple and basically ordered one of everything. Every dish was fantastic!

I would definatey say best vegan food I have had hands down.  I will take that further and say if all vegan food was this good it would put all the other restaurants out of business and cover majority of people to vegan.

I had such a wonderful experience at Fancy Radish. I am not vegan (or even vegetarian), but do try to eat plant based several times a week. The food at Fancy Radish was some of the best I've ever had, of any category. I didn't feel neglected at all. If anything, it was a night of indulgence. Our server was helpful and attentive. The entire experience was positive. I'll be dreaming about the strawberry shortcake for a long time to come and can't wait to go back.
Amazing flavours, great service, reasonably priced!
Delicious food! Excellent to share! Amazing!

The service here was surprisingly awesome! I really appreciate waiters and hostesses that are truly happy to help you. I got a table right away even though I walked in after 9pm and I had a helpful waiter to go over the entire menu with me. Since it was my first time there, I was overwhelmed with the menu and the waiter went through the entire thing with me. Talk about customer service! The radish salad was great and so was the corn chowder. These 2 dishes together are filling and don't include pasta/bread which I like because I try to limit carbs when I can. I also got the strawberry shortcake and that was perfect! So yummy. Loved the experience!  One suggestion: Maybe you can have essential oil jars on the tables instead of candles? Safer and better for us to breath in
Deeeelish!
Great place
Sat at the bar and received great service. Food was delicious! Will definitely visit again!

Amazing food and very attentive servers. I can't recommend highly enough. Well worth the price - some of the best cuisine I've ever had. Make a reservation- fills up very quickly. Treat yourself to the fanciest of radishes. Personally recommend the ramen, which I could eat until I literally couldn't. But it was all amazing.
Amazing little plates of beautiful veggie deliciousness!

Fancy Radish is easily my favorite restaurant in DC. Everything from the food, to the space, to the service is just incredible. The staff are so knowledgeable about their food and drinks and are always so friendly. The food will blow you away - every bite is delicious. This place is unique and special - I couldn’t recommend it more.
Awesome food! Great services. A bit pricey but absolutely worth it. Za'atar grilled maitake for 19$ was definitely the best. The fondue was 14$ and could be more cheezer.
Unbelievable.  Best meal ever.
Novel, healthy, delicious, fun experience, fancy!
One of the best restaurants we’ve ever eaten at, vegan or otherwise. Every dish was great, although the dan dan noodles were a little too spicy and oily (but still good!) service was great.
The best vegan restaurant in all of DC hands down. Every dish was incredible and we ordered almost all of them. Waitress knew the menu very well and knew exactly what we would like.
One of the best gourmet vegan restaurants I’ve been to. We were a little less impressed with our wines but still a great experience.

Good presentation, & it's nice to have another vegan restaurant, but disappointing experience. Portions were small, & I think the "small plate" format is tiresome & stale. Most of the plates tasted great, but some, like the ramen, were overpriced, for what they were. Other dishes seemed like all presentation, little substance; just a handful of tasty components painted onto a plate, with little synergy. The wine list could use some work, & one of the employees exhibited a poor attitude. For something like $60-$70/head, there should be a lot more food on the plate.
Been here twice and have enjoyed the food, service, and ambience every time.
Very good food wine
Astonishingly delicious vegan food. So much better than the other options in town

Rosie, our waitress, is adept at explaining the intricacies of the unique dishes... And recommended most of our dinner selections. The tasty treats titillated our taste buds. A must dine for vegans, vegetarians, veggie or non veggie lovers. Fancy Radish is masterful in its creative use of the full panoply of vegetarian and non meat ingredients. We enjoyed four of the dessert offerings. The selection of sorbets and ice creams included mango chili lime, strawberry lemonade and key lime pie. We recommend the dark chocolate namelaka...and the maitake...or "hen of the woods" mushroom offering...along with the signature dish "Fancy Radish".  Smoked tofu will change your concept of bland tofu...its inspiration is a smoky cheese flavor. The charcuterie of complex flavorful vegetables is unique and creative... including pastrami carrot. Reservations early are a must. We will be dining at the two sister Philadelphia restaurants where we live soon: Vedge and V Street.

The service was wonderful and the decor was very nice and inviting. The Stuffed Avocado was the star of the meal. Also really enjoyed the Za'atar Grilled Maitake, it had excellent flavors throughout the dish. The Peruvian Potatoes were nice at first, but the salt was definitely present. The Dan Dan Noodles were so very salty, there was basically no flavor besides salt. It was so overpowering, it wrecked my palate. For an expensive meal, it tasted kind of cheap. I left craving vegetables, which was weird for just having dined at a vegan restaurant.

The only reason the Fancy Radish didn't get 5 stars from me was because of the price point. Otherwise, the dishes we had were absolutely delectable. Such creativity went into the menu and every bite was immensely delicious (the charcuterie board was a great example of such creativity) . The price point should be a bit lower to afford ordering more of the shared plates, but otherwise, a tasteful experience!

Ugh. 6/5 stars please. Fancy Radish gave me one of the top overall dining experiences I've ever had, between the hosts and the food and the service and the decor. It was all around perfection. Let's start with the drink menu: cocktails galore for people of all alcohol persuasions, and I personally was super excited by the fact that they have orange wines because so few places in DC do. from what I can tell the menu rotates based on the season, which is great because everything was fresh and interesting. The menu has about 10 options in total, and between me and my one other friend we ordered six dishes which was just more than we could eat in one sitting. My personal favorite items were the rutabaga fondue and the Peruvian potatoes. I don't know how these chefs manage to make a vegan food so creamy and delicious but they're killing the game and make amazing food. Run, don't walk, to Fancy Radish. You will not be disappointed.
Fantastic food! Classy cocktails 👌

Did the full menu, tried every dinner item they had on the menu at the time. Don't know if I've eaten such a vegan centric meal before, but everything was tasty and enjoyable. Didn't think I would like smoked tofu so much, but I did. I love butter, but thankfully there are plenty of plant based fats that exist because all the meals were enjoyable.

Solid and ceative vegan dishes. Good place to share a bunch of plates with a group. Very fresh ingredients and specific flavors. Must try the strawberry shortcake! Staff is very kind and knowledgeable of the menu. Environment is inviting and energetic. Prices a little on the high end but pretty goos value overall and great experience! Will be returning. Recommend getting a reservation as it seems to get pretty busy.
We had been to both restaurants in Philly, and this is the best of both.  Outstanding service with delicious, creative food that happens to be vegan.  Make your reservations now!

A great vegan restaurant with creative dishes and nice concept. Dishes are small so you can order several to share and try different things. Some dishes were exceptional, like the stuffed avocado. Others were disappointing, like the bland Brussel sprouts and overly rich dandan noodles. Overall a great experience.
Creative, delectable, good for the world!

Went there yesterday. Food are decent though priced a bit high (I know it's a vegan place). I was not happy with the way I was treated by one of the waitresses there (I do not want to put her name on here). She has short hair and tattoos. I ordered the Dan Dan noodles and I said this would be enough for now. If I needed more food I would order something else. I was given a very uncomfortable look (sometimes frown eyebrows). Whenever she took order she always looked at my friends but not me (as I was trying to make eye contact to order the food). I did not feel welcome the entire time. This being said, I will not visit this restaurant again. If you feel like giving your customer an attitude then you shouldn't be working in customer service.
A gastronomic delight!! All the food was yummy and our hostess new every dish on the menu and was very informative!
My best ever vegan experience! A vegan restaurant where meat eaters won’t want for anything. We so wish you would expand to London.

My best friend knows that I am a vegetarian so she thought of this place. I was really excited because I have heard great things about this place. I think we started with the pretzel bites and they were amazing!! warm and delicious. Then we got Utabaga Fondue I believe, which was also great. I don't remember what drinks we got but we both loved our drinks. We concluded the night with the sticky toffee pudding which was to die for. I did enjy Reason no five stars? TERRRIBLEEE CUSTOMER SERVICE. constantly had to track down our waiter. That was annoying-especially because I was hungry! But I would come back again! Hopefully they have better service next time! Parking, is a hit or miss but circle the block you'll be fine.

Phenomenal! Owned by same owner as Vedge and V-street in Philly and equally recommendable. Even if you eat meat you will not feel disappointed - the tastes are so rich and versatile! Also I had a chance to try orange wine for the first time and absolutely loved it!
Each dish well-thought out. Ingredients all complement one another. Attentive and pleasant servers.  One of my favorite vegan restaurant.
Such great food and drinks. The service was excellent. It was on the expensive side but totally worth it!

I think I have the holy grail!! Fine dining vegan food! I have been here about  6 or 7 times at this point and I try to try something a little different. Let go down  the list: stuffed avocado was not my favorite at all it did not taste like anything in particular,  it had different textures but it seemed too salty; Peruvian potatoes,  dont be fooled, it is a very  hardy dish with thick cut potatoes, dried olives peanuts and semi-spicy sauce  on top, one of my 2nd favorites; spicy Dan Dan noodles is not a joke and it definitely bring all the spice, it's a ramen with crispy shiitake mushrooms for great texture; Za'atar grilled maitake, is hands down my favorite dish so oh all time. It has a little  of everything, every time bite into the food its a different taste. The whipped lemon tahini is really what makes or is my favorite. You have to eat about two or three dishes to be full. Do not forget about desert! I love the butter scotch panna cottage, guava cream chesse empanadas and the sticky toffee pudding. The menu changes in a accordin to the season,  but never a big change .This place is original and not your typical fried that you will get at your typical vegan Restaurant. Note, I always sit at the bar because I am usually  by myself,  I have never had a bad experience, and the bartenders will tell you the truth and will  never over sell you.  Real food for real people! At the end of the day there something for everybody,  meat eaters will definitely enjoy  this place trust me!😉 *special thanks to Max! Will go out his way to sure  you have everything you need, most of all this is a great staff and a wonderful experience! * please and enjoy  the experience!

I have been needing a place like the fancy radish in my life. The food was absolutely delicious from start to finish. I had half the menu (2 items from each of the 3 sections) and then 2/4 desserts. If you come here, be open minded. From the surprise of the beet toast to threading the needle so perfectly between savory and spicy in the Peruvian potatoes this place is a winner in my book.

DELICIOUS!!! If you went to this restaurant and no one told you it was vegan, you would never know. The flavors are amazing and complex. We literally ordered every item on the menu and lived each one. Beautiful space. Will return many times more.
Fantastic food. Unbelievable creativity! Great friendly service.
This is the best vegan meal I've ever had outside of their Philly restaurant Vedge.
This place is a must visit. The dishes and the atmosphere must be experienced
Pretty good for the most part. A bit over priced considering the serving size. Highly recommend making a reservation, this place fills up quickly.
Fabulous plant based food, incredible tastes and flavors. A must!!!

Amazing veg food! The menu items are gourmet and each app is delicately and beautifully made. The creativity in flavors of the food is excellent.  We shared about 6 dishes among 4 friends and were satisfied. Perhaps we eat less as a group then others. The mushrooms are all prepared amazingly! I’d definitely go back.
I found the dishes that we ordered were delicious but the most for me was the Spicy Dan Dan pasta. Great amount of spice.

This was a delightful place to visit for a girls night out! The fancy radish dish was the best seared radish I have ever had and the vegan fondue was to die for. Cocktail was perfectly balanced-bourbon, dry sherry and chai. I love this place and the friendly staff. Host was extra sweet helping us find open seats at the bar once they were available. Thank you!
Amazing. From decor, to service, to food and cocktails. Everything was TOP notch. If you're vegan or plant based and in DC you gotta try it out!
eat at the bar!

A nice gem. We actually just walked in a bit past eight and was able to sit at the bar facing the kitchen without a wait. I love the rutabaga fondue and Dan Dan noodles, but my date loved the maitake mushroom and stuffed avocado... go figure. You won’t believe this restaurant is vegan.  FYI, I think their regular dinner menu is much nicer than their happy hour. There’s a reason the food on the HH menu is only offered two hours a day and only at the bar, it’s meant for snacking and is much more simple in preparation. The shishito peppers are good, olive tagine is not bad, and prob wouldn’t venture to order the taco or broccoli salad again.
Amazing food! You will never miss the meat
Amazing!
Interesting tastes and sauces...tapa sized, some a bit bigger,.....vegan fare....not a place for a steak dinner.
It is criminal to make a 1000% profit on a bottle of wine. Most of the bottles listed on the menu for 60/70 are worth less than 10$ at a liquor store.
I am by no way shape or form vegan, but after going to this restaurant, things might change... Food and service are absolutely fantastic. H St is lucky to have Fancy Radish.
Incredible vegan selection. Had a wonderful night here sample way too much :-). Drinks are unique and on point as well!

Creative culinary dishes bursting with flavor! Glad I chose Fancy Radish for my birthday dinner. All the dishes combine interesting ingredients and textures that surprisingly work well together and tickle my taste buds with rich flavor. It's a paradise for vegans and even meat lovin' hubby loved all the dishes!  The Celery Fritter app was my favorite - never knew celery could taste so good! The creamy avocado cilantro sauce with chunks of celery paired perfectly with the crispy fritters stuffed with veggies. Even my hubby who hates celery with a passion enjoyed the fritters!  The Rutabaga Fondue was my hubby's favorite with creamy rich fondue and warm soft pretzel roll. The fondue tastes like cheese with a pop of flavor from the root rutabaga vegetable. I wish we asked for another pretzel roll to mop up all that creamy fondue!  The Stuffed Avocado with cauliflower rice and puffed shell with tangy sauce was another stand out dish. I appreciate how the sauce is on the bottom to elevate the flavor in every bite.  The roasted Peruvian Potatoes with cheesy sauce and crunchy peanuts and black sesame seeds was also quite tasty.  Although the spicy Dan Dan Noodles looked appetizing, I'm glad we went with the creamy Sunchoke Ramen. The noodles were cooked al dente with rich creamy sauce.  The best part was dessert! The S'mores bar was divine with a decadent brownies, creamy marshmallow "ice cream" made of coconut milk (didn't melt!), dusted with graham cracker crumbs, and topped with a birthday candle! Love the modern take on S'mores and was thoroughly stuffed by the end of the meal.  The cocktails were a bit disappointing and don't measure up to the food. They are mostly whiskey based or have a strong citrus flavor, they need to be a bit more balanced out.  I wasn't a fan of the bubbly Back to the Basics, it tasted like a lemon drop. The sparkling wine was quite dry and the eldenflower didn't add the hint of sweetness that I was hoping for.  The Winter Travels packs a punch with scotch, rum, and brandy. It tastes like an Old Fashioned with a hint of sweetness from the cranberry cordial.  My hubby enjoyed the boozy Woodmaze with bourbon, cherry, and chai. I would like to see the cocktail menu retooled with more vodka based cocktails.  Definitely make a reservation, I was turned down as a walk-in even though half the restaurant was empty.  Excited to come back for another round of those celery fritters and warm pretzel roll as well as venturing into new culinary dishes!
Best vegan place ever!
Scrumptious flavors on sumptuous plating (e.g., brûlée’d marshmallow spiral under chocolate)
Great food and atmosphere. Pricey but worth it.
Delicious food, excellent drinks. Worth the money for a special night out. My favorites are the fondue and the Dan Dan noodles.
What an awesome meal! The service was wonderful, the food was amazing, just all around phenomenal. You just have dessert!
Delicious and beautiful food. If your want exotic, original vegan food, this is the spot for you. Fancy, yet chill. Make a reservation!
We ordered 6 dishes and 2 desserts. We were stuffed. Everything was delicious! Dishes have no peer and will leave you speechless.
This is my favorite vegan food! The pretzel bread and fondue is a must.

Great spot for small plates of delicious vegan foods.  You will need a reservation. We ordered 5 dishes plus two desserts and cocktails for two people.  The beet toast was spectacular and the smoked carrot dip also excellent.  Mushrooms in broth  tasted rich like butter.
I really like how creative their dishes are

I don't think I've ever loved a restaurant more than this one. I was first excited at it being vegetarian and not a tofu and soy based menu! It's location oh H street is in a very trendy area with easy parking. The decor and ambiance is great very calming, the staff was wonderful and really made the experience special. The silverware and dishes we're switched after every dish, which added an extra special factor to the experience. Now the dishes, we ordered the stuffed avocado, rutabago fondue (my personal favorite), Peruvian potatoes, trumpet mushrooms, Dan Dan noodles (spicy), all were delicious and would recommend. Every dish was presented beautifully and had an explosion of taste. Even though I was stuffed we ordered dessert because o just wanted the full experience so we're gluttonously ordered 2 desserts because o couldn't decide, we ordered the toffee pudding and the s'mores brownie. My husband loved the pudding, which was my least favorite meal. I thoroughly enjoyed the brownie it was so rich and de adwnt, I couldn't finish it.

Great experience. I was early to my reservation so I sat at the bar and had a signature drink only available at the bar. It was a great mix and that was just the start. When finally seated we ordered 6 dishes because they are slightly smaller sizes. Split between two people it was very filling and very delicious. They also are very open to gluten free options. I am pretty sure every menu item can be gluten free. The service was excellent, very friendly and attentive.
Fantastic
Dc doesn’t have enough vegan options. Stoked to have something from the vedge family in dc!
Absolutely phenomenal. Would love to buy a cookbook.
Great service at the bar. Well mixed drink and delicious food. You would not believe it was a vegan restaurant unless you were told it beforehand.

One of the best meals I have had this year.  So much flavor in everything.  The chioggia  beet toast is insanely good.  The Dan Dan noodles were amazing.  Seared Maitake with smoked remoulade was also a stand out.  The desserts were killer as well. Stand out dessert was S'mores.  Everything was elevated beyond my previous vegan meals and the prices were cheap for the quality of food.  I will be back to try the rest of the menu.

I tried 5 entrees in one night and every dish hit a home run!!!! This place is wonderful. Smoked Carrots, Tofu, Peas and Carrots, Stuffed Avocado , Beet Toast. You guys must expand to other major cities. Vegans everywhere would enjoy your cuisine. And a Fancy Radish cookbook would be on the best seller list.  The service was phenomenal!!!!!!! Everyone was so attentive . Never had to ask for anything.  This place deserves more than 5 stars. I will make reservations there every time I visit your city. THANK YOU FOR THE WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE!!!!!! WELL WORTH EVERY PENNY. One of D.C.s hidden treasures. Do I recommend this place? ABSOLUTELY!!!!!! Dress code, come as you are. Staff will make you feel at home😍🤗☺😁. If anyone has something negative to say about this place, they can't truly be vegan. Trust me.
One of the best meals I’ve ever eaten
One of the best restaurants on h street ne

Oh how I love Vegan restaurants that make amazing food! There aren't many of them out there, but this is one of them!!! The fondue and pretzel bread loaf accompaniment are nom nom nom scrumptious!!! The mushroom appetizer and main entree were to die for, especially the starter. Cocktails here are a delight as well...interesting tastes mixed together for the win! Ohh... And the service! Everyone was informative and friendly. I highly recommend eating here as often as possible!
Thank you for bringing your magical Vedge goodness from Philly to DC!  Wonderful birthday experience ("I don't have to worry about any of these ingredients!")  We shall return soon, with friends.
Best food I think I've ever had. Every detail of every dish was thoughtful and so tasty. Will return for sure.

Amazing vegan food. Loved it all. Best things were the fondue and beet toast. Mushrooms were also good. Peruvian potatoes were yummy but quite spicy.  The noodles were yummy but less novel. Craft cocktails were yummy too.

Our server recommended 2 to 3 dishes per person. Since we were a party of 6, two dishes per person equalled the number of dishes on the menu, so we ordered one of each with the idea of ordering more of our favorites if we were still hungry. My favorites were the mushroom dishes, the lentil and butternut squash, and the peas and carrots ramen. I also liked the Brussels sprouts dish, but it wasn't on the menu. Everything was very good.

We are vegetarians with an Indian palate. We eat dairy and eggs. Party of four ordered all twelve items on the menu. To our surprise, all four of us unanimously enjoyed all the meals( that is a very difficult task). Obviously there were some outstanding dishes including my favorite in order 1. Chioggia Beet Toast 2. Mushroom dish 3. Fondue . 5. Peruvian potatoes, etc. I think 2 plates per person is fine and 3 per person can be a little too much. Cocktails were great. Ordered a Mezcal drink very smoky. Service- very good and food came out faster than expected. We had to tell them to slow down. Our waitress named Aly was outstanding and very knowledgeable. I would recommend for anyone wanting a different taste and nice ambience and service. We ordered 12 plates, 1 dessert and 6 drinks for about $75/ person.

How can vegan food be so good!? I discovered this place after eating at Vedge in Philly. Our waiter there told us they were setting up this spot in DC. Fancy Radish does not disappoint and I am so glad we still get to enjoy some of the amazing dishes we had in Philly here in DC.

Fancy radish is a wonderful and interesting food experience created by Chef Rich Landau and Kate Jacoby. All the dishes are delicately assembled. They look beautiful and taste even better. I love food that is different and adventurous. Fancy radish distinguishes itself with its beautifully presented and delicious food. The cocktails are amazing. The portions are small. I would advise ordering two per person and sharing them. The deserts are incredible. It is a vegan restaurant but I don’t think that you miss any flavors  because the food is just so awesome. It’s fusion cuisine featuring dishes like Peruvian potatoes and Dan Dan noodles. There is a parking garage just opposite. The restaurant itself is fairly small. The staff are charming. I would not hesitate to visit again but it is expensive so it would need to be a special occasion.
Would give it 10 stars if I could.  Such a great meal served by a knowledgeable and friendly staff.  Each dish was well prepared,  well spiced and incredibly delicious.  Must try.

I just discovered Fancy Radish last week and have systematically gone through half the menu in three different trips. This has become my favorite restaurant in DC! The prices are reasonable, the service is top notch, and the menu is inspired.  I've had the stuffed avocado every time I've gone and I have seriously considered getting it twice in one night. The tomato tart from the romesco sauce is balanced by the buttery avocado and the crunch of the fried rice.  The Peruvian potatoes come with a rich yellow, spicy aji Amarillo sauce that they should bottle and sell to the masses. I could pour the sauce over cardboard and eat it.  The rutabaga fondue comes with tart pickled vegetables and (what seems like) freshly baked bread. Vegan fondue perfected!  H street has slowly become a hub for good vegetarian food but it seems as if Fancy Radish competes with the intimate sit down restaurants more than the other vegetarian spots. A truly memorable dinning experience and I can't wait for the brunch!!
Extremely delicious. Super creative. Highly recommended.

Vegan or not, go to this place because it's amazing. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because my guest and I were asked to leave because someone was waiting 30 minutes for a table ... That was really bad form.

The food was absolutely delicious! I loved the fried avocado, fondue and trumpet mushrooms dish. The s'mores dessert was OUTSTANDING! I would recommend that everyone visits this restaurant at least once. The staff was incredibly friendly and knew my friend by name as a returning visitor. Great place!

This is an exceptional restaurant.  DC has come a long way that it is possible to have such an amazing dining experience here.  Absolutely go.  Dessert was slightly disappointing, but every other course was artful and wildly delicious.
I went with a friend and we shared 3 dishes from the top of the menu and two from the bottom, along with a dessert. We both loved everything! Our server was great and really helpful.

Amazing restaurant. Vegan or not, this place is a must try! You won’t even miss the meat because the food is that good. And the service is spectacular! I loved the fondue and the BLT the most.  I went with two other people and two plates per person was more than enough. My only complaint is that the desserts left a lot to be desired. They were good, but they didn’t blow my mind like all of the entree dishes did.
Delish!

For my birthday I made late night reservations for a party of 5. I arrived 10min early to see how the setup and vibe is (being my first time here) I sat at the bar waiting until time for my seating. Bartender addressed me I told him it was my birthday an I don’t usually drink so I may not have a drink. He said he WILL make a drink for me and not to worry about it. The drink he offered was too strong for me so he made another. Still very strong he made another( by the tone of his voice I could see he’s tolerance was running thin) I then asked if my table is ready. The hostess then said the people siting at the table is going to leave soon...I felt bad to rush someone to finish their meal for my party to eat, especially when i made my reservation 2 weeks in advance. By having a reservation I’m expecting to walk in be greeted accordingly and have my table ready to seating. But instead I was billed 2 drinks, a lady at the bar picked up my tab saying I don’t understand why he gave you those drinks they are strong an I’m a drinker... i greatly appreciated the gesture. Now that it is 15min pass my time to be seated I asked for a table and addressed that I made a reservation so I should have a seated area ready for my party, shortly afterwards was redirected in a corner of a table of 4, while the original table of 6 (I was told and shown I'm to be seated at) is still accompanied but 3 people finishing their drinks. at the table the server was not as attentive as i thought. i wanted to have a conversation about the food and what to expect but the server just wanted to place the orders and leave us alone. hardly any interaction, had to ask for refills of water, had to ask for everything....very disappointed to celebrate my birthday dinner at this place. Over all being a fancy place, service was nothing to the name. Food however is nice... service 👎 I do not recommend this place for a special occasion, but as a stop by eat at the bar type. yes, then you don't have to worry about the service to much you can just enjoy the food and be pressured by the bar tender to buy drinks back to back as long as your seated their.
Lovely vegan food.
Inventive dishes and great wine selections.

Minimalist decor very low key. Food was very delish, in fact quite filling. Sat at the bar, awesome, no wait. Unfortunately the bartender kept pressuring us to order more food. It made me annoyed and uncomfortable like i was at my moms house like please im capable of asking for more food if i need it. The dishes are NOT small plates. They are average sized for many restaurants, and 2 plates is more than enough! The food was excellent tho, and the cocktails were very good too! The smores desert was quite rich, so good for sharing! Cant wait to come back, would love to sit at the chefs table, so cute.
Quality food and locally grown ingredients. Make reservations prior
Great spot. The food is phenomenal. 100 percent worth a visit.
My new favorite restaurant.
Delicious vegan tapas.  And, no music which makes it easy to have a conversation!

TL;DR- Loved it! Delicious food and it's all plant-based. Not (too) oily or heavy. I went here with a date (non-vegan) and he loved the food, too. It's on the edge of $$ and $$$. It's kind of like a tapas bar in that they have a bunch of small plates and you order multiple for your meal. They recommend 3 per person, which works out to be at ~$45 for your main meal per person. If you want drinks and dessert that will be even more. I don't think neither of us were very hungry, so we only ordered 3 plates, 2 drinks and 2 desserts between us. > Rutabaga Fondue: 4/5. They served us pretzel bread with the fondue and a mixture of pickled veggies. The flavor of the fondue is somewhat cheezy, but it's very much a plant-based cheese. It doesn't imitate the flavor or texture of real cheese much. Even so, it was still tasty, but nothing to rave about. > Peruvian Potatoes: 5/5. This was my favorite dish of the evening and was recommended to me by the waitress. I can see why it's popular! The sauce is absolutely delicious. There's a kick, but I highly recommend if you can handle spicy dishes. I have a high spice tolerance the spice level was medium-high for me. > Spicy Dan Dan Noodles: 5/5. Another popular dish recommended by the waitress. Not as good as the peruvian potatoes, but still spot on and memorable. The noodles had a great bite, the sauce was spicy (but in an Asian way). Around the same level of spice (maybe a little less) than the Peruvian potatoes) > Staycation: 4/5. A surprising combination of coffee, coconut and pineapple. The sweetness of the coconut and was toned down by the coffee. I was concerned about the caffeine, but it didn't have a strong (or any?) effect on me. > Woodmaze cocktail: ?/5 My date's drink. Very bourbon-y and served in an English china teacup. I tasted it and had a strong bourbon taste yet was mellowed out by the other flavors added. > Blueberry Tart: 5/5. This was my dessert. I really enjoyed the refreshing combination of the lemon, blueberries and frangipane.The poppy seed ice cream was meh, but I didn't mind because I loved the tart so much. I'm glad it wasn't overly sweet. The fresh blueberries and lemon curd cut through the sweetness of the dish nicely. > Peaches and Cream: 4/5. The flavors here were great. It was almost like a decomposed peach pie with the hush puppies, peach sorbet and cream. It seemed much less substantial than the blueberry tart, which is why I deducted a star (which is weird, considering that this dessert is more expensive).

This place was very much needed in DC which surprisingly has very few fully vegan options.  We ordered probably 3/4 of the menu.  Our favorites were the BLT, fondue, and potatoes.  I could eat and endless supply of those potatoes, great flavor with the dried olive and spices sauce.  For the main I had the dan dan which was a great rich dish with a good kick of spice and tasty crisp mushrooms.  Another main we ordered was the grilled summer squash which was a very flavorful lighter option.  For desert we had the strawberry sorbel which was very tasty with the saffron ice cream.  However the s’mores dessert takes the cake. It was a great mix of nostalgic flavors mixed with bbq nuts and a more rich chocolate.  My only gripe here is the serving sizes. If you are hungry expect to order at least three dishes each.
Amazing place that offer delicious vegan menu.

We went in late around 9pm on a Friday night and were lucky to get a table immediately without any reservation and all the tables were occupied as the restaurant itself was quite small. The decor was contemporary with an industrial look and the light fixtures were unique. We ordered cheese fondue,Peruvian potatoes,Dan Dan noodles and strawberry sorrel bread pudding. Everything tasted good. The service was very good and the staff were very friendly. The Cons-Portion size is quite small for the price. It costed us around 90$ for two people with one drink each.
Great place! Dishes while small were satisfying.

Very considerate servers, sitting in front of cooks (difficult not to want everything!), extremely delicious mushroom dishes, avocado starter, appealing BLT toast, spicy noodles (no oil), and great tofu! Can’t wait for dessert!

Possibly the best dinner I've ever great, certainly in the top 5. Dishes and drinks are innovative and amazingly delicious. As a vegan, I rarely easy at a restaurant and way food that I couldn't make at home. Fancy Radish is the definite exception! It's hard to do gourmet vegan, but they've accomplished it. This will, without a doubt, be a regular visit every time we're in the DC area!
Incredible food!! Incredible service!! By far one of the best foodie spots in the DMV!!
Great place. Exceptional vegan food.   Unique combinations.  Waitstaff extremely personable.   A must if you are vegan.

I went here with a group of six, after waiting over a month for our reservation. The only thing higher than our anticipation was our expectations. Fancy Radish did not disappoint. First, with a group of six, we were able to order the whole menu. I'm not exaggerating, we ordered every dish on the menu. We also ordered 6 different cocktails, and 4 of the six desserts. Therefore, I feel very qualified to write this review of the restaurant as a whole. Our group contained vegetarians, pescatarians, omnivores, and meat-lovers alike. Every single person, including our skeptical meat-lovers, walked away feeling full and in a dream-like state. Every dish was beautifully presented even more delicious than the last. A very special shout out to the rutabaga fondue, mushroom pasta, beets, and dan dan noodles. If you eat anything here, you must get those. The staff was incredible. Our waitress took the time to discuss the menu, talk us through her favorites, and as each dish came out - highlighted some of her favorite flavor profiles. Our water dishes never reached below half-full, and she consistently traded our personal plates for clean ones so that flavors stayed separate. The cocktails were unique, delicious, and had enough variety that you could find one for every person in your group. The desserts, while not as outstanding as the entrees, were still delicious and a wonderful way to end your evening. The ambiance was cozy and romantic, with plants and interesting light fixtures abound. Our favorite part? The price. While Fancy Radish is a higher end restaurant, we did not find the price to be prohibitive. It was more than your typical night out, but I've eaten much less quality food for a higher price in DC.  All in all, we absolutely loved our experience. We're already comparing calendars to make our next reservation. I could not recommend enough, it was a wonderful evening.
The absolute best vegan food I've ever tasted. This place is amazing! The service was also exceptional. We loved the rutabaga fondu and the langos especially.
Didnt have the food yet, but the decor and atmosphere are great!

Though I'm an ardent meat lover, would not have any problem giving up it up if I could eat food prepared and served by Fancy Radish every day!  Went there to dinner last night, not sure what to expect, and it turned out that every dish we ordered was a hit and the server was very accomodating and helpful throughout the evening!  The Chermoula Grilled Tofu, finely slathered with eggplant, was firm and slightly crispy, and the rich Stuffed Avocado with tangy romesco sauce was outstanding with so many complementary flavors.  The vegan Rutabaga Fondue, served with fresh, warm pretzel bread and pickles for dipping, was a winner in the Comfort Food category!  At our server's recommendation, we saved room for dessert with the Sumac Sour Cherries, warm donut holes in a cherry sauce, and the tiramasu-like Atlantic Beach Cup, layers of lemon custard, cream and raspberries with a crunchy bottom.  Accompanied with extraordinary cocktails throughout the meal, including the whisky-based Woodmaze served in a tea cup, Fancy Radish is a home run definitely worth repeating!

I was so excited to eat here based on the reviews but was bitterly disappointed. The small plates were not filling enough, and we got the max recommended. The only good thing was the pretzel and cheese fondue but there wasn't enough pretzel to cheese ratio. When we asked for more, we were given a pretzel cut in half, a not-so-subtle hint to not request more pretzel for the overpriced dish. A dinner for 3 people here ended up being $150 and we ended up getting dessert at Farewell bc we found the meal to be so disappointing.
Delicious food & drinks, but oh my gosh the prices are really high! I had no idea it was small plates...not sure if I will go back, unless it’s just for an appetizer.
Excellent food and service. Great prices. Nice atmosphere. Perhaps the best vegan restaurant on the East Coast (aside from Vedge which is owned by the same folks). 5 stars!
If you like spicy, the dan dan noodles are delicious!

The Fancy Radish is a place that can turn me vegetarian. The way they infused flavors to make things taste like cheese blew my mind. Anyone who is or isn't vegetarian should try this place. It will change your perspective on eating meat. Even if for a moment.
Great place for Veg. Great service and ambiance
The food was amazing! Staff also increable its often hard to find a great veggie focused restaurant.
Great spot for a nice night out. I highly recommend the fondu and ramen dishes. Beer pours are quite small though.
Everything is absolutely delicious!!!!!!!

So good. I loved the small plates. We ordered 6 small plates and 2 desserts to share between 4 people and it was perfect. We were all satisfied and we had a little taste of everything. I love being able to go to a resturant and know that I can order anything because it is all plant based! Our server was super helpful and really friendly.  If you can get a reservation, do it!
You will NOT miss meat here. One of the most flavorful meals in my life.
Portion sizes extremely small, but food is very tasty
Best food I've had in a while. Great presentation, quality food, nice staff.

Had an early dinner on Friday evening. Were seated immediately and served most pleasantly and accommodatingly by Aly, who saw to it that sauces containing raw cilantro were on the side for my wife.  Raphanous shade cocktail, given a couple of minutes for ice to partially melt, was luscious. All dishes: Peruvian potatoes; ful; chermoula tofu; and Dan Dan noodles were delicious. Blueberry tart as well. Espresso was made from very good coffee, but needed more foam and should have been available as decaf. Spoons for on-the-side sauces and espresso should have been on the table. Overall, a delicious dining experience.

The service and the food were exceptional. I'm not even a vegan, and I loved the food. The flavors were super interesting, and the presentation was also very good. This is the only upscale vegan restaurant in DC, and it's definitely worth the experience (even if you're not vegan). Word of caution: the Dan Dan Noodles are indeed super spicy, so unless you can handle heat, I would steer clear.
White tablecloth vegan dining from the couple that created Vedge in Philly. Excellent expensive food.

Wonderful vegan food, with a full gluten free menu. The fondue is a MUST, and their GF bread is really incredible. I would skip the stuffed avocado and fancy radishes( it’s fairly bland) but the trumpet mushrooms were absolutely amazing. We ordered about 5-6 dishes for four people and it was plenty.
Just because you're vegan doesn't mean you only want ONE carrot for dinner. Portions were very stingy and flavorless.
The dinner was sensational, very impressed by the quality of the food, uniqueness, and speed with which we received it. Well worth the price

If you’re an omnivore and want to experiment with eating at a vegetarian restaurant, go elsewhere because you’ll leave Fancy Radish hungry and unsatisfied. For a place that specializes in vegetables, they sure are stingy with them (rutabaga fondue, spicy dan dan noodles, and chermoula grilled tofu) - particularly at these gentrified H Street prices. To boot, the two-seater tables are flanked too close for comfort along the wall and you have to raise your voice to have a conversation. The staff is friendly, though!
Love the food. Love the people. Hit it out the park. Drove from Philadelphia just to eat here!!!

Loved the birthday dinner for my husband. We got the beets (I am pretty sure they are beet whisperers), rutabaga fondue (silky and unctuous) , the pea tendrils and asparagus in the smoked onion dashi (divine) , the Peruvian potatoes (comforting and spicy), the spicy dan dan noodles (beautiful texture and spice) and the smoked tofu (super savory and delicious). We had the sticky toffee (our favorite) and the Zatar jelly donuts! The staff was super sweet, attentive and absolutely wonderful. We could not have asked for a better experience !

I was really excited to try Fancy Radish, but the food didn’t live up to the hype. While plated beautifully, many of the dishes we tried (i.e the stuffed avocado, the fancy radishes, and the roasted carrot) were bland. The only thing I’d go back for is the Spicy Dan Dan noodles.
Amazing food and cocktails, centering on bringing vegetables to their full potential. Don't miss the rutabaga fondue, maitaike, jelly doughnuts, and peridot meteor!

My husband and I brought two of our non-vegan friends from out of town here on Saturday night and everyone absolutely LOVED it.  It makes me so happy to have a place like this to widen my friends views on how versatile and delicious plant-based food can truly be.  Every dish was unique and incredibly tasty! We ordered so much food to split between the four of us and we were all so blown away with each plate. It was definitely one of the best meals I’ve ever had as everything was perfectly cooked, flavorful, beautifully presented and so mouthwateringly delicious and savory.  I really like the high end side of vegan food.  Our tops picked were the spicy dan dan noodles, rutabaga fondue, Peruvian potatoes, trumpet mushrooms and the seared maitake.  Fancy Radish’s mushroom game is so on point!  I cannot wait to come back!  A huge thank you to Chefs Rich Landau and Kate Jacoby for bringing down their passion and wisdom to the DC area!!
Best veg restaurant in DC, hands down!

Incredible plant based menu with a great assortment of options. Don't be turned off thinking this is a vegan restaurant. The food is great for anyone who likes to eat...pro tip, get the fondu. Make reservations a week or so in advance, or wing it and try and snag a spot at the bar.
Would love to give 5 stars.  But food was just...meh.  Rutabaga fondue is amazing....and then everything just becomes decent.  Not bad. Not great...just okay.

My meat-loving. Boyfriend and I ate at the bar and  with the expert guidance of the staff chose among the really imaginative menu .  Everything from start to finish, including the signature cocktails was awesome. These are small plates so we were able to try quite a variety .  Can’t wait to introduce my vegetarian daughter !
Amazing. A mix of Vedge & V St. DC finally has a delicious vegan restaurant!

Great food serviced by great people. They have a uniquely curated and interesting selection of cocktails, wines, and beer. It's vegan fair for those that want good eats without the piety many such establishments traffic in. Lots of bold flavors and fun textures. Service was phenomenal; that this is their first weekend in operation makes it all the more impressive. A solid Philly addition to the DC scene.

Fancy Radish is a game changer for the DC veg scene. The flavors are fresh, vibrant, and extremely creative. The ambiance is trendy and inviting. The cocktail scene here is also impressive. The chef and beverage manager are certainly in lock step!  Weather I need a drink after a long week or a fun affordable creative dinner with colleagues any day of the week, Fancy Radish is a great place I will be putting at the top of my list.
Some of the best food I've had in DC served by charming people. Can't wait to get back and looking forward to this being a regular
